body_html: Hm you might be right. It really seems like you need to wrap the code with if __name__ == "__main__": on Windows machines. Maybe checkout this issue #2341. Seems also to be referred to here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/brokenpipeerror-errno-32-broken-pipe-when-i-run-cifar10-tutorial-py/6224
body_text: Hm you might be right. It really seems like you need to wrap the code with if __name__ == "__main__": on Windows machines. Maybe checkout this issue #2341. Seems also to be referred to here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/brokenpipeerror-errno-32-broken-pipe-when-i-run-cifar10-tutorial-py/6224
body: Hm you might be right. It really seems like you need to wrap the code with `if __name__ == "__main__":` on Windows machines. Maybe checkout this issue #2341. Seems also to be referred to here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/brokenpipeerror-errno-32-broken-pipe-when-i-run-cifar10-tutorial-py/6224
